analyzed: de las thur mas bskus na mdze dang / sha bkra dang / sme ba dang / pags pa'i mdog snag tsha 'dra bar gyur pa dang / gzhang 'brum dang / pags pa'i sha mdzer dang de rnams 'joms par byed do //
translated: When smeared with a spoon from that, it destroys leprosy, vitiligo, moles, skin the color of ink, hemorrhoids, and skin warts.

original: mdor na sha bkra yod pa'i nad pa la ni slon khrus kyis lus dag par bya ba dang / gtar gas khrag dbyung ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba'i zas kyis lus rtsub par bya ba dang / phye'i zas rnams bsten to //
analyzed: mdor na sha bkra yod pa'i nad pa la ni slon khrus kyis lus dag par bya ba dang / gtar gas khrag dbyung ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba'i zas kyis lus rtsub par bya ba dang / phye'i zas rnams bsten to //
translated: In brief, for a patient with a skin disease, the body should be purified by bathing, bloodletting should be performed, the body should be made rough with salty and astringent foods, and foods made from flour should be consumed.

original: gal te de dag sdig pa zad pa lta na sos pa srid kyi de lta ma yin na ni gso dka'o //
analyzed: gal te de dag sdig pa zad pa lta na sos pa srid kyi de lta ma yin na ni gso dka'o //

original: de nas srin bu gso ba bshad de //
analyzed: de nas srin bu gso ba bshad de //
translated: Then, the treatment of worms is explained.

original: de la khong pa'i srin bu bad kan las gyur pa la ni thog mar snum chos dang dugs byas la /
analyzed: de la khong pa'i srin bu bad kan las gyur pa la ni thog mar snum chos dang dugs byas la /
translated: For worms in the stomach that arise from phlegm, first perform oil therapy and fomentation.

original: bu ram dang 'o @264b ma dang sbyar ba btung ba 'am /
analyzed: bu ram dang 'o @264b ma dang sbyar ba btung ba 'am /
translated: Drink a mixture of jaggery and milk,

original: yang na nya shal sogs pa bza' ste /
analyzed: yang na nya shal sogs pa bza' ste /
translated: or eat fish entrails, and so on.

original: nub mo bde bar bsnyal la srin bu kun rang gi gnas las byung nas /
analyzed: nub mo bde bar bsnyal la srin bu kun rang gi gnas las byung nas /
translated: At night, lie down comfortably, and all the worms will leave their abodes

original: zas mngar bag can la 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas mngar bag can la 'du bar 'gyur ro //

original: de'i 'og tu bye'u rug pa'i sde tshan ba gcin dang chu dang bskol la de'i nang du pi pi ling dang / po son cha dang / byi dang ga dang / sva rtsi ka'i thal ba dang / 'di rnams phye mar byas la til mar dang sbyar nas bkru sman drag po mas gtong bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bye'u rug pa'i sde tshan ba gcin dang chu dang bskol la de'i nang du pi pi ling dang / po son cha dang / byi dang ga dang / sva rtsi ka'i thal ba dang / 'di rnams phye mar byas la til mar dang sbyar nas bkru sman drag po mas gtong bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in a decoction of the group of the birds, urine, water and boiled, in it, the powder of long pepper, posoncha, bishandaga, and the ash of svarjika, having made these into powder, mix with oil and give a strong purgation.

original: de ltar ni ru ha mas gtong ba'i rjes la bkru sman gtang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni ru ha mas gtong ba'i rjes la bkru sman gtang bar bya ste /

analyzed: tri bi ta dang / po son cha dang / pi pi ling dang / 'di gsum gyi phye ma bye'u rug pa'i sde tshan bskol ba'i nang du btab la blud do //

original: khong pa'i nang dag par bya'o //
analyzed: khong pa'i nang dag par bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar slon khrus byas pa'i rjes la tsha ba ldas btab pa'i 'bras thug sbyin par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas sman tsha ba dang kha ba bskol ba'i chus lus la blugs par bya'o //

analyzed: slon khrus kyis lus dag par byas nas /
translated: Having purified the body with the purgation,

analyzed: byi dang ka'i mar gyi 'jam rtsi mas gtong bar bya'o //

analyzed: mgo bo'i srin bu la ni mgo khrus kyi sman du bshad pa gtang bar bya'o //

analyzed: bza' ba ni shin tu tsha ba dang / kha ba dang snum cung zad dang bcas pa sbyin no //

translated: Alternatively, one should give a drink mixed with honey in the juice boiled with any of these: ≈õrƒ´≈õa, girikar·πáƒ´, paribhƒÅdaka, kabhaka, palasha seed, mand≈´ra, and p≈´tikƒÅ.

analyzed: yang na bye'u rug pa'i sde tshan las sman gang yang rung ba sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gu bldag par bya'o //

analyzed: yang na bye'u rug pa'i sde tshan dang / tri bi tsa'i phye ma dang byi dang ga dang chu dang bskol ba'i nang du btab pa blud do //

analyzed: srin bu can la gong gi sde tshan gyi sman dang / tri bi tsa'i phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba bldag sa pa 'am /

translated: For head worms, one should apply an ointment of the juice of squeezed horse dung, any medicine from the group of partridge, and the powder of trivrit.

analyzed: gzhan yang srin bu'i nad kun la dra ban ti'i ge sar legs par btags la bag phye dang bsres la btsos pa'i snum khur bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, for all worm diseases, make a good paste of the stamen of the flower of draben ti, mix it with flour, and eat it as a fried cake.

original: de nas 'bras kyi skyur po 'am tsha blud do //
analyzed: de nas 'bras kyi skyur po 'am tsha blud do //
translated: Furthermore, in all worm diseases, one should eat a fried cake made from the filaments of the red lotus, mixed with flour, and then drink sour rice or hot water.

original: yang na cha ba lnga dang / lan tshva btab pa'i dar ba yang sla tsam sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na cha ba lnga dang / lan tshva btab pa'i dar ba yang sla tsam sbyin no //

translated: Or one should eat a fried cake made from the leaves of the Indian jujube tree, mixed with flour, and then drink the above beverages.üîΩOr one should eat a fried cake made from the flour of the Indian jujube fruit, mixed with flour.

analyzed: yang na byi dang ga shun ba bor ba'i nang gi 'bru btags la / ba la ta ga'i mar dang cha snyoms te bsres la phyed ni kha nas btung /
translated: Or one should mix the seeds of the Indian jujube fruit, which have had their outer skin removed,üîΩwith an equal amount of ghee from a cow, and drink half of it.

original: phyed 'jam rtsi thabs su mas btang la nyi ma tsha ba la 'der gzhug go /
analyzed: phyed 'jam rtsi thabs su mas btang la nyi ma tsha ba la 'der gzhug go /
translated: Half should be given as an enema, and one should lie in the hot sun.

original: yang na sa ra la dang / thang shing gi mar cha snyoms la bsres te /
analyzed: yang na sa ra la dang / thang shing gi mar cha snyoms la bsres te /
translated: Or else, one should mix together the oil of the sarala tree and the oil of the pine tree.

original: gong ma'i cho ga bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i cho ga bzhin bya'o //
translated: One should do as in the previous ritual.

original: bshang ba'am mi gtsang ba'i nang du skyes pa'i srin bu la ni khrus dang 'jam rtsi btang ba las 'da' ba med do //
analyzed: bshang ba'am mi gtsang ba'i nang du skyes pa'i srin bu la ni khrus dang 'jam rtsi btang ba las 'da' ba med do //

original: nges par gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges par gtang bar bya'o //
translated: One should definitely apply them.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i srin bu la ni mgo bkru ba'i sman dang / slon dang / khong du zhi ba'i sman gtang ngo //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i srin bu la ni mgo bkru ba'i sman dang / slon dang / khong du zhi ba'i sman gtang ngo //
translated: For worms born from phlegm, one should give a head-washing medicine, a purgative, and a medicine to be taken internally.

original: khrag las gyur pa'i srin bu la ni mdze nad gso ba'i cho ga ltar bya'o //
analyzed: khrag las gyur pa'i srin bu la ni mdze nad gso ba'i cho ga ltar bya'o //
translated: For worms born from blood, one should do as in the ritual for curing leprosy.

original: khrag las gyur pa'i srin bu dang / skra rtsa za bar byed pa'i srin bu ni /
analyzed: khrag las gyur pa'i srin bu dang / skra rtsa za bar byed pa'i srin bu ni /
translated: For worms born from blood and worms that eat the hair roots,

analyzed: ain dra lub ta zhes bya ba mgo gso ba'i cho ga 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin gso'o //
translated: one should cure them as in the ritual for curing the head, which will be explained below.

original: rnag las skyes pa'i srin bu la ni rma 'grams pa'i dpyad 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: rnag las skyes pa'i srin bu la ni rma 'grams pa'i dpyad 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin bya'o //
translated: For worms born from pus, one should do as in the treatment for wounds, which will be explained below.

original: srin bu yod pa rnams kyis kha zas 'di dag spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: srin bu yod pa rnams kyis kha zas 'di dag spang bar bya ste /
translated: Those who have worms should avoid these foods.

analyzed: 'o ma dang / sha dang / mar dang / bu ram dang / zho dang / sngo rngad kyi tshod ma dang 'di rnams mi bza' ste /
translated: They should not eat milk, meat, ghee, molasses, curd, or green vegetables.

analyzed: mdor na mngar ba dang / skyur ba rnams spang bar bya'o //
translated: In brief, they should avoid sweet and sour foods.

original: gso ba'i gnas las sha bkra dang srin bu'i nad gso ba'i le'u nyi shu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gso ba'i gnas las sha bkra dang srin bu'i nad gso ba'i le'u nyi shu pa rdzogs so /
translated: Here is the conclusion of the twentieth chapter, the chapter on the treatment of anemia and worm diseases, from the Secret Quintessential Instructions on the Eight Branches of the Ambrosia Essence Tantra.

original: // / de nas rlung nad gso @265b ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas rlung nad gso @265b ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: de la rlung rlung nad 'ba' zhig bad kan dang / mkhris pa ma 'dres pa la ni tshil dang / mar dang / rkang dang til mar te bzhi po de dag las btung ba la sogs pa'i snum chos sbyar ro //
translated: In the case of wind diseases that are not mixed with phlegm or bile, the four types of oil therapy, such as drinking, should be applied using fat, ghee, bone marrow, and sesame oil.

original: de nas rlung nad can gyi nad pa de khong snum gyis zhen par gyur nas bar der ngal bsos la de'i 'og tu snum chen po bzhi 'o ma dang lhan cig tu sbyar te snum chos su bya ba dang / de bzhin du grong dang /
analyzed: de nas rlung nad can gyi nad pa de khong snum gyis zhen par gyur nas bar der ngal bsos la de'i 'og tu snum chen po bzhi 'o ma dang lhan cig tu sbyar te snum chos su bya ba dang / de bzhin du grong dang /
translated: Then, when the patient with a wind disorder is satisfied with the oil, he rests for a while, and after that, the four great oils are applied with milk in an oil therapy.

translated: Similarly, any meat broth of creatures living in towns, on plains, or in water is applied with the four great oils, and one drinks rice gruel, sour krƒ´·π£ara, and salt, and after that, one applies a soft enema with oil.

original: sna sman dang skyo ma dang / kha zas rnams kyang snum dang sbyar ba sbyin no //
analyzed: sna sman dang skyo ma dang / kha zas rnams kyang snum dang sbyar ba sbyin no //
translated: Nasal medication, soup, and food are also given with oil.

original: de ltar khong snum gyis zhen par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar khong snum gyis zhen par gyur na /
translated: When the patient is satisfied with the oil in the stomach,

analyzed: snum chen po bzhi btang zhing gding ba'i dugs la sogs pa yan lag brgyad pa bsdus pa las 'byung ba rnams 'dir sbyar ro //
translated: Apply the four great oils and the eight branches such as the steam bath of the coverlet and so forth.

translated: If one has a wind illness, the body becomes light and empty, stiff, and painful. If one does the steam bath with oil, one will be able to perform the activities of the body as one wishes.

analyzed: ji ltar shing skam po yang dugs dang snum la sogs pa'i cho ga byas na /
translated: If one performs the ritual of the steam bath with oil and so forth on a dry tree,

analyzed: ci dgar mda' la sogs pa byar yod na /
translated: one can do whatever one wants with the arrow and so forth.

original: lus can rnams la smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: lus can rnams la smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention embodied beings?

analyzed: de ltar dugs byas pa'i yon tan ni ba spu langs pa dang / na ba dang / zug gzer che ba dang / rtsol ba mang ba dang / lus skem pa dang / rengs pa la sogs pa myur du zhi bar 'gyur zhing lus kyi sha mnyen par 'gyur /
translated: The qualities of the steam bath are that the body hair stands up, the sicknesses, the great pain, the great exertion, the emaciation of the body, the stiffness, and so on, are quickly pacified, and the flesh of the body becomes soft.

analyzed: rlung na ba'i nad pa la snum chos sbyar ba'i yon tan ni /
translated: The benefits of applying oil therapy to a patient with a wind illness are as follows:

analyzed: de ltar rlung nad can gyi skyes bu la lan cig ma yin par phog mang du snum chos dang dugs yang dang yang byas na /

analyzed: khong snum zhing 'jam par 'gyur te /

analyzed: rlung nad gnas par mi 'gyur ro // gal te @266a * //
translated: and the wind illness will not persist.

analyzed: snum la sogs pa gong ma'i sbyor ba de dag gis ma zhi na ni nges par nad gzhan dang 'dres pa yin te /

analyzed: de nas bkru sman 'jam po snum dang bcas pa btang ste /

analyzed: yang na ae randa'i mar 'o ma dang bskol ba blud na /

original: nad 'phrog cing zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad 'phrog cing zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The disease will be carried off and pacified.

translated: Give this together with Gyam tsha and honey. The benefits are the same as above.üîΩAlternatively, grind the seeds of white radish in goat's milk and drink it together with the goat's milk. This is beneficial for poisoning, tumors, dropsy, abscesses, pustules, and erysipelas.

original: nas phye 'am yang na ku ba kha bo'i sa bon gang yang rung ba'i ku ba'i rang khus bsgos te skyo mar byas pa blud na bad kan las gyur pa'i rims dang / lud pa dang / lkog ma'i nad dang / ma zhu ba rnams la phan no //
analyzed: nas phye 'am yang na ku ba kha bo'i sa bon gang yang rung ba'i ku ba'i rang khus bsgos te skyo mar byas pa blud na bad kan las gyur pa'i rims dang / lud pa dang / lkog ma'i nad dang / ma zhu ba rnams la phan no //
translated: For those with a predominance of baekan disorders, administer either barley flour or the juice of white radish mixed with water to make a gruel. This is beneficial for fevers, phlegm, throat disorders, and indigestion.

original: skran dang rims rnying pa la ni ku ba kha bo'i phye ma sha khu dang lhan cig blud na legs par skyug cing nyam chung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skran dang rims rnying pa la ni ku ba kha bo'i phye ma sha khu dang lhan cig blud na legs par skyug cing nyam chung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For tumors and chronic fevers, it is good to induce vomiting with a decoction of the dried fruit of the white-flowered citron together with meat soup. In this way, vomiting will be good and the patient will not become weak.

original: ku ba kha ba'i 'bras bu dang / me tog rang gi khu ba bskams te btags pa'i phye ma me tog gi phreng ba la bsgos te man man bde bar skyug par byed do //
analyzed: ku ba kha ba'i 'bras bu dang / me tog rang gi khu ba bskams te btags pa'i phye ma me tog gi phreng ba la bsgos te man man bde bar skyug par byed do //
translated: The dried fruit and flowers of the white-flowered citron are ground into a powder. This powder is strung on a flower garland and chewed. This induces vomiting without discomfort.

original: skyid de ba'i skyug sman du sbyar ro //
analyzed: skyid de ba'i skyug sman du sbyar ro //
translated: This is used as a pleasant emetic medicine.

original: lud pa dang / skran dang // dmu rdzing @277a * //
analyzed: lud pa dang / skran dang // dmu rdzing @277a * //
translated: It is also used for phlegm, tumors, dropsy,

original: dang ; lkog ma'i nad dang / de bzhin du rlung bad kan gyi gnas su zhugs pa dang / kha dang mgrin par bad kan gnas pa dang / bad kan sogs shing brtan pa'i nad rnams la sman dha mar ka'i skyug sman 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: dang ; lkog ma'i nad dang / de bzhin du rlung bad kan gyi gnas su zhugs pa dang / kha dang mgrin par bad kan gnas pa dang / bad kan sogs shing brtan pa'i nad rnams la sman dha mar ka'i skyug sman 'dod pa yin te /
translated: and goiters, and likewise for vata and kapha disorders that have entered the site, and for stable disorders of phlegm and so forth that are located in the mouth and throat. For these, the emetic medicine of dhamarka is desired.

original: zangs rtsi ba dang / kha sral phre'u dang / nye'u shing dang / ram nye ba rnam gnyis dang / shra ba ni dang / me da rnam gnyis dang / ma du li ka dang / 'di rnams gang yang rung ba'i phye ma dang / ra dz'a ko sha ta ki zhes bya ba dha mar ka'i phye ma dang bcas pa sbrang rtsi dang sha kha ra dang sbyar ba'i lde gu zos na lung pa dang snying tsha ba la rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: zangs rtsi ba dang / kha sral phre'u dang / nye'u shing dang / ram nye ba rnam gnyis dang / shra ba ni dang / me da rnam gnyis dang / ma du li ka dang / 'di rnams gang yang rung ba'i phye ma dang / ra dz'a ko sha ta ki zhes bya ba dha mar ka'i phye ma dang bcas pa sbrang rtsi dang sha kha ra dang sbyar ba'i lde gu zos na lung pa dang snying tsha ba la rab tu bsngags so //
translated: The powders of any of these: copper, iron, tin, lead, zinc, brass, bronze, or aluminum, together with the powder of rajakoshtaki, mixed with honey and sugar, when taken as a linctus, is highly recommended for lung and heart-ailments.

original: mkhris pa tsha ba dang bad kan dang ldan pa la yang gong gi sbyor ba gang yang rung ba chu dro 'jam tsam dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //
analyzed: mkhris pa tsha ba dang bad kan dang ldan pa la yang gong gi sbyor ba gang yang rung ba chu dro 'jam tsam dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //
translated: For those with hot bile and phlegm, any of the above preparations may be taken with just a little warm water.

original: 'u su dang g-yer ma bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du dha mar ka'i phye ma btab ste blud na dug nad 'joms so //
analyzed: 'u su dang g-yer ma bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du dha mar ka'i phye ma btab ste blud na dug nad 'joms so //
translated: A decoction of ushira and barley, to which has been added the powder of dharmaraka, if drunk, conquers poisoning.

original: bim pa dang / ba spru ba dang / ka sa mar dha ka gang yang rung ba bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du dha mar ka'i 'bras bu gcig gam gnyis mnyes la tshigs ma bor te dangs ma blud na snying nad la phan no //
analyzed: bim pa dang / ba spru ba dang / ka sa mar dha ka gang yang rung ba bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du dha mar ka'i 'bras bu gcig gam gnyis mnyes la tshigs ma bor te dangs ma blud na snying nad la phan no //
translated: Boil the juice of any of the following: ba lu, ba sha ka, or kasa mar dhaka. Add one or two dhamarka fruits, strain it, and drink the clear liquid. This is beneficial for heart disease.

original: dha mar ka'i 'bras bu 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te /
analyzed: dha mar ka'i 'bras bu 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te /
translated: Boil dhamarka fruit with milk.

original: de las byung ba'i mar btung ba 'am /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mar btung ba 'am /
translated: Drink the ghee that comes from this.

original: yang na po son cha dang / dug mo yungs dang / dzi mu ta'i 'bras bu dang / kri ta be ta na dang / 'di rnams re re nas sbyor ba de ltar byas na skyug sman du bzang ngo //
analyzed: yang na po son cha dang / dug mo yungs dang / dzi mu ta'i 'bras bu dang / kri ta be ta na dang / 'di rnams re re nas sbyor ba de ltar byas na skyug sman du bzang ngo //
translated: Alternatively, prepare a purgative using one of the following: poson cha, dukmo yungs, jimuta fruit, or krita vetana.

original: mdze dang / skya rbab kyi nang dang / mcher pa'i nad dang / skrang pa dang / skran dang / sbyar ba'i dug dang / 'di rnams la ni tsha ba dang / rno ba dang / dro ba'i skyug sman bsngags so //
analyzed: mdze dang / skya rbab kyi nang dang / mcher pa'i nad dang / skrang pa dang / skran dang / sbyar ba'i dug dang / 'di rnams la ni tsha ba dang / rno ba dang / dro ba'i skyug sman bsngags so //
translated: For leprosy, ascites, spleen disease, swelling, tumors, and compound poisons, a hot, sharp, and warm purgative is recommended.

original: po son cha dang / ku ba kha bo dang / dha mar ka dang / dug mo yungs dang / dzi mu ta dang / kri ta be dha ka de rnams gang yang rung ba gcig dang / ko sha ta ki @277b cha snyoms te bskol ba'i khu ba dang /
analyzed: po son cha dang / ku ba kha bo dang / dha mar ka dang / dug mo yungs dang / dzi mu ta dang / kri ta be dha ka de rnams gang yang rung ba gcig dang / ko sha ta ki @277b cha snyoms te bskol ba'i khu ba dang /
translated: The decoction of any one of the following: posoncha, kubakabo, dhamarka, dukmo yung, jimuta, and kritavedhaka, mixed with the decoction of koshtaki,

original: yul ser che ba nas byung ba'i sha khu dang lhan cig bskol te /
analyzed: yul ser che ba nas byung ba'i sha khu dang lhan cig bskol te /
translated: and the soup of meat from a yellow-colored region, should be boiled together.

original: lan tshva dang bcas pa blud do //
analyzed: lan tshva dang bcas pa blud do //
translated: Add salt and administer.

original: yang na po son cha la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gang yang rung ba cig dang / pi pi ling cha mnyam pa ko sha ta ka'i khu ba dang sbyar ba 'am yang na ko sha ta ki bskol ba'i khu ba dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na po son cha la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gang yang rung ba cig dang / pi pi ling cha mnyam pa ko sha ta ka'i khu ba dang sbyar ba 'am yang na ko sha ta ki bskol ba'i khu ba dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Alternatively, administer the decoction of any one of the following fruits: posoncha, etc., mixed with pippali and koshtaki decoction, or the decoction of koshtaki alone.

original: dug mo yungs kyi sbyor ba'i skyug sman ni byis pa shin tu gzhon nu la gtang ba yin te /
analyzed: dug mo yungs kyi sbyor ba'i skyug sman ni byis pa shin tu gzhon nu la gtang ba yin te /
translated: The emetic preparation of dukmo yung is for very young children.

original: de bzhin du bad kan dang khrag mkhris dang bcas pa dang / rims dang / shu ba mched pa dang / snying nad dang / dreg nad dang / mdze dang / 'di rnams la rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bad kan dang khrag mkhris dang bcas pa dang / rims dang / shu ba mched pa dang / snying nad dang / dreg nad dang / mdze dang / 'di rnams la rab tu bsngags so //
translated: and these [ailments].

original: yungs kar dang / ma du ka dang / rgyam tsha dang / de rnams gang yang rung ba bskol ba'i khu ba 'am /
analyzed: yungs kar dang / ma du ka dang / rgyam tsha dang / de rnams gang yang rung ba bskol ba'i khu ba 'am /
translated: Boil any of these - white mustard, madhuka, or sea salt - in water,

original: yang na dug mo yungs kyi sa bon kri sa ra dang ldan pa skyug sman gyi don du blud do //
analyzed: yang na dug mo yungs kyi sa bon kri sa ra dang ldan pa skyug sman gyi don du blud do //
translated: or give the seeds of white mustard together with k·πõsara as an emetic.

original: dug mo yungs kyi sa bon aarka'i 'o ma'i nang du zhag bdun gyi bar du bsgos shing bran te /
analyzed: dug mo yungs kyi sa bon aarka'i 'o ma'i nang du zhag bdun gyi bar du bsgos shing bran te /
translated: Soak the seeds of white mustard in the milk of arka for seven days,

original: bskams la btags pa'i phye ma po son cha dang / dzi mu ta dang / ku ba kha bo dang / dzi ban ti dang / dzi ba ka dang / de rnams gang yang rung ba cig bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du btab ste blud do //
analyzed: bskams la btags pa'i phye ma po son cha dang / dzi mu ta dang / ku ba kha bo dang / dzi ban ti dang / dzi ba ka dang / de rnams gang yang rung ba cig bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du btab ste blud do //
translated: grind them, dry them, and make a powder. Mix that powder with the juice of any of these boiled - poson, jimuta, sour cucumber, jƒ´vantƒ´, or jƒ´vaka - and give it.

original: slon sman gyi sbyor ba po son cha la sogs pa 'di dag ni gtsor smos pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: slon sman gyi sbyor ba po son cha la sogs pa 'di dag ni gtsor smos pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: These ingredients such as Soncha, the compounder of medicinal butter, are just the main ones.üîΩIntelligent people should apply them as appropriate, based on what appears in other texts.

original: skyes bu blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis gzhung gzhan las 'byung ba rnams kyang ci rigs su sbyor cig / cho ga grub pa'i gnas las le'u dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: skyes bu blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis gzhung gzhan las 'byung ba rnams kyang ci rigs su sbyor cig / cho ga grub pa'i gnas las le'u dang po rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the first chapter of the treatise on the methods of accomplishing the ritual.

original: // / de nas bkru sman gtang ba'i cho ga'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas bkru sman gtang ba'i cho ga'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the chapter on the ritual of administering purgative medicine will be explained.

original: de la dur byid dang po zos shing ma zhu ba'i tshe na ni ro bskal mngar zhing rtsub pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dur byid dang po zos shing ma zhu ba'i tshe na ni ro bskal mngar zhing rtsub pa yin te /
translated: When first eating Haritaki and it is undigested, its taste is sweet and rough.

original: zhu nas ni ro tsha ba yin la bad kan dang mkhris pa 'joms shing rtsub pas ni rlung 'khrug par byed do //üîΩdur byid de sman dang sbyar na ni rlung dang @278a * //
analyzed: zhu nas ni ro tsha ba yin la bad kan dang mkhris pa 'joms shing rtsub pas ni rlung 'khrug par byed do // dur byid de sman dang sbyar na ni rlung dang @278a * //
translated: After digestion, its taste is hot. It destroys phlegm and bile, and its roughness agitates wind.üîΩWhen that Haritaki is combined with medicine, it destroys the three humors of wind,

original: mkhris pa dang bad kan gsum 'joms te /
analyzed: mkhris pa dang bad kan gsum 'joms te /
translated: bile, and phlegm.

original: khyad par du cho ga bzhi ldan par byas na nad gzhi thams cad las rgyal bar byed do //
analyzed: khyad par du cho ga bzhi ldan par byas na nad gzhi thams cad las rgyal bar byed do //
translated: Especially, if it is performed with the four-fold ritual, it conquers all illnesses.

original: dur byid de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dur byid de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of hyoscyamus:

original: rtsa ba smug nag tu 'dug pa dang / dur byid dkar po dang gnyis su bshad do //
analyzed: rtsa ba smug nag tu 'dug pa dang / dur byid dkar po dang gnyis su bshad do //
translated: the root is described as either dark brown or white.

original: de gnyis las dur byid dkar po ni mchog tu bsngags te /
analyzed: de gnyis las dur byid dkar po ni mchog tu bsngags te /
translated: Of these two, white hyoscyamus is highly recommended.

original: cho ga bsrung mi dgos shing bkru sman 'jam po yin te /
analyzed: cho ga bsrung mi dgos shing bkru sman 'jam po yin te /
translated: It does not require protection by ritual and is a mild purgative.

original: skyid de ba sdug ma myong ba rgan po dang rgyu snyi ba rnams la gtang ba yin no //
analyzed: skyid de ba sdug ma myong ba rgan po dang rgyu snyi ba rnams la gtang ba yin no //
translated: It is given to the elderly and those with weak channels who have not experienced much suffering.

original: dur byid smug nag ni brgyal zhing rmongs bag tu byed la /
analyzed: dur byid smug nag ni brgyal zhing rmongs bag tu byed la /
translated: Dark brown hyoscyamus causes fainting and confusion.

original: mgrin pa gra mas gang zhing brud pa ltar byed la /
analyzed: mgrin pa gra mas gang zhing brud pa ltar byed la /
translated: It fills the throat with mucus and causes vomiting.

original: rno zhing myur du 'khru ba'i bdag nyid yin pas lto shin tu sra ba dang / nad gzhi mang pos nyam thag ste lus shin tu zad pa la bsngags so //
analyzed: rno zhing myur du 'khru ba'i bdag nyid yin pas lto shin tu sra ba dang / nad gzhi mang pos nyam thag ste lus shin tu zad pa la bsngags so //
translated: It is sharp and has a quick effect, so it is recommended for those with very hard stomachs and those who are weak from many illnesses.

original: dur byid de btung ba'i dus su yang rtsa ba g-yas g-yon du ma 'phros shing zabs su drang por 'dug pa de phyung la dbus kyi snying po bor te shun pa bskams la sbas nas snod du gzhug go //
analyzed: dur byid de btung ba'i dus su yang rtsa ba g-yas g-yon du ma 'phros shing zabs su drang por 'dug pa de phyung la dbus kyi snying po bor te shun pa bskams la sbas nas snod du gzhug go //
translated: When it is time to drink the milk, pull out the root without spreading it to the right or left, and without going deep. Discard the middle essence, dry the bark, hide it, and put it in a container.

original: de nas bkru sman du sbyar ba ni rlung nad can la ni dur byid phye mar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bkru sman du sbyar ba ni rlung nad can la ni dur byid phye mar bya ste /
translated: Next, the preparation as a purgative: For those with wind disorders, make a powder of the milk.

original: rgyam tsha dang / bca' sga nyung zad dang / skyur dang sbyar te blud do //
analyzed: rgyam tsha dang / bca' sga nyung zad dang / skyur dang sbyar te blud do //
translated: Mix it with a little rock salt, asafoetida, and sour substances, and administer it.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad la ni dur byid mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang kha ra dang bcas pa 'o ma dang rgun chu dang bu ram shing gi khu ba dang tang pal dang sman mngar ba'i sde tshan dang / 'bras bu gsum dang /
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad la ni dur byid mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang kha ra dang bcas pa 'o ma dang rgun chu dang bu ram shing gi khu ba dang tang pal dang sman mngar ba'i sde tshan dang / 'bras bu gsum dang /
translated: For diseases arising from bile, mix the milk with ghee, honey, sugar, milk, grape juice, sugarcane juice, date palm, the sweet group of medicines, and the three fruits.

original: de rnams kyi khu ba gang yang rung ba dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi khu ba gang yang rung ba dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Administer any suitable juice from those.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i nad la ni s'a lu'i khu ba dang / ba gcin dang / rtsabs skyur po dang / tsha ba rnam lnga'i khu ba dang bad kan 'joms pa'i sman nyung shas dur byid kyi phye ma dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i nad la ni s'a lu'i khu ba dang / ba gcin dang / rtsabs skyur po dang / tsha ba rnam lnga'i khu ba dang bad kan 'joms pa'i sman nyung shas dur byid kyi phye ma dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: For diseases arising from phlegm, give a drink of rice water, cow's urine, sour radish, the juice of the five hot herbs, and a small amount of phlegm-destroying medicine mixed with turmeric powder.

original: dur byid bskol ba'i khu ba grang mo'i nang du kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi dang / dri sna gsum dang sbyar ba blud pa 'am /
analyzed: dur byid bskol ba'i khu ba grang mo'i nang du kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi dang / dri sna gsum dang sbyar ba blud pa 'am /
translated: Or give a drink of cooled boiled turmeric juice mixed with sugar, honey, and the three pungent substances.

original: yang na dur byid kyi phye ma kha ra dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lnga gu bldags na bkru sman yid du 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na dur byid kyi phye ma kha ra dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lnga gu bldags na bkru sman yid du 'ong ba yin no //
translated: Or chew a betel nut mixed with turmeric powder, sugar, and honey. This is a pleasant purgative medicine.

original: aa dz'a gan dha dang / smyig rkang dang / bi da ri dang / sha kha ra dang / 'di rnams dang dur @278b byid kyi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang mar sbyar ba'i lde gu bldags na 'dus pa dang / rims dang / lus rengs pa dang /
analyzed: aa dz'a gan dha dang / smyig rkang dang / bi da ri dang / sha kha ra dang / 'di rnams dang dur @278b byid kyi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang mar sbyar ba'i lde gu bldags na 'dus pa dang / rims dang / lus rengs pa dang /
translated: Chew a paste of azagandha, bamboo pith, vidari, and shakara mixed with turmeric powder, honey, and ghee. This cures all diseases, fevers, and body stiffness.

original: lus tsha ba dang / skom dad kyis gzir ba legs par 'khru bar byed do //
analyzed: lus tsha ba dang / skom dad kyis gzir ba legs par 'khru bar byed do //
translated: It is good for cleansing the body when it is tormented by heat and thirst.

original: yang na bu ram shing gi sdong bu bkas te /üîΩdum bu gnyis su byas pa'i nang ngos dur byid kyi phye ma lde gur byas te ;
analyzed: yang na bu ram shing gi sdong bu bkas te / dum bu gnyis su byas pa'i nang ngos dur byid kyi phye ma lde gur byas te ;
translated: Or, cut a sugarcane stalk in half,üîΩand with the inner part make a paste ofüîΩmustard seed powder.

original: bskus te slar sbyar bas snod kha sbyar gyi nang du cho ga bzhin du tshos par byas nas zos pa na 'dus pa las gyur pa'i nad legs par 'khru bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskus te slar sbyar bas snod kha sbyar gyi nang du cho ga bzhin du tshos par byas nas zos pa na 'dus pa las gyur pa'i nad legs par 'khru bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Smear the inside of the two halves, and then join them. Cook them in a covered vessel according to the rite. When eaten, it is good for cleansing the body of diseases arising from the humors.

original: shing tsha dang sug smel mnyam pa dang / de gnyis dang mnyam pa'i ni li ni dang / sman gsum po de dag dang mnyam pa'i dur byid dang / sman de bzhi dang mnyam pa'i sha kha ra dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma rgun 'bru'i khu ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang phyes btab pa'i skyo ma 'thungs na rlung dang /
analyzed: shing tsha dang sug smel mnyam pa dang / de gnyis dang mnyam pa'i ni li ni dang / sman gsum po de dag dang mnyam pa'i dur byid dang / sman de bzhi dang mnyam pa'i sha kha ra dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma rgun 'bru'i khu ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang phyes btab pa'i skyo ma 'thungs na rlung dang /
translated: Take equal parts of turmeric and dry ginger, and equal to those two parts, neem, and equal to those three herbs, mustard seed, and equal to those four herbs, sugar. Drink a decoction of these powders in grape juice with honey and spices. It cures all diseases of the three humors.

original: mkhris pa dang / bad kan las gyur pa'i nad dang / me'i drod chung ba dang / skyes bu skyid de ba dang / shin tu gzhon pa rnams la cho ga bsrung mi dgos par 'khru bar byed do //
analyzed: mkhris pa dang / bad kan las gyur pa'i nad dang / me'i drod chung ba dang / skyes bu skyid de ba dang / shin tu gzhon pa rnams la cho ga bsrung mi dgos par 'khru bar byed do //
translated: Those who are afflicted by bile, phlegm, or a combination of the two, those who have low digestive heat, those who are happy, and those who are very young do not need to follow the procedure and can bathe without it.

original: byi dang ga phub ma med pa dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / nas tshig 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / pi pi ling dang / sman sna gcig gi sum 'gyur gyi dri bi tsa dang / de rnams kyi phye ma sbrang rtsi 'am /
analyzed: byi dang ga phub ma med pa dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / nas tshig 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / pi pi ling dang / sman sna gcig gi sum 'gyur gyi dri bi tsa dang / de rnams kyi phye ma sbrang rtsi 'am /

analyzed: de la ni snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva sbyin no //
